Validate Power Analysis Design

validate_power_design.Rd

Helper function to validate the design components before running a full power analysis. Performs a single simulation run and checks for convergence and parameter extraction.

Usage

validate_power_design(
  n_control,
  n_treatment,
  simulate_data_fn,
  model_formula_true_params,
  model_formula_estimation,
  family,
  priors_true_params,
  priors_estimation,
  target_param,
  brms_args = list(algorithm = "sampling", iter = 1500, warmup = 500, chains = 2, cores =
    1, init = 0.1, control = list(adapt_delta = 0.9))
)

Arguments

n_control

Number of participants in control group

n_treatment

Number of participants in treatment group

simulate_data_fn

User-defined function that takes (n_control, n_treatment) and returns a data frame

model_formula_true_params

brms formula object for design model with true parameters

model_formula_estimation

brms formula object for estimation model

family

Distributional family for brms

priors_true_params

Priors with true parameter values (as constants) for design model

priors_estimation

Priors for estimation in power simulation

target_param

Name of the parameter to track for power calculation (without "b_" prefix)

brms_args

Arguments passed to brms for validation runs. Default includes algorithm="sampling", iter=700, warmup=200, chains=2, cores=1. User can override any of these or add additional arguments.

Value

A list containing validation results, model summaries, and compiled design models (brms_design_true_params and brms_design_estimation) that can be reused in power_analysis()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Validate design before running full power analysis
validation <- validate_power_design(
  n_control = 50, 
  n_treatment = 50,
  simulate_data_fn = simulate_data,
  model_formula_true_params = model_formula_true,
  model_formula_estimation = model_formula_est,
  family = gaussian(),
  priors_true_params = priors_true,
  priors_estimation = priors_est,
  target_param = "grouptreat"
)
} # }
